title: Chilwell
author: Chilwell
content: The Central Bank of Nigeria, CBN, has informed citizens that there will be no cash swap for old notes in any financial institution.The CBN already declared the old N200, N500 and N1000 are no longer recognized as legal tender, despite a Supreme Court ruling.The apex bank on Tuesday released the guidelines for deposit of old notes at any of its branches across the country from February 15 and 17.CBN explained that in exchange for the old notes, the bank account provided by the depositor will be credited after scrutiny.“You will not be issued new notes; instead your bank account will be credited after your account is validated by law enforcement,” it said.Noting that the process may take up to four weeks, the guideline said the deposited notes will be withheld if validation of the owner’s account turns out negative.Also, deposits by a third party are not allowed; the account information provided must be that of the depositor.Account owners are required to complete an online application form and generate a reference number before heading to the CBN.In a case where a customer did not pre-fill their form, he/she will be given the opportunity to fill the form at the branch.Requirements are the reference code generated from the CBN portal, an active bank account, Bank Verification Number, BVN, and a valid government identity card.The advice added that the Cash Deposit Window is open to the public from today until Friday between 9am to 2pm daily.Source:Link: https://dailypost.ng/2023/02/15/feb-17-deadline-for-old-notes-cbn-releases-guidelines

comments.body: I don already see this news yesterday, the thing just they add to the confusion wey Naija people they face so because we no know whether the supreme court go overturn wetin CBN don already talk, the supreme court don already tell CBN say make them halt their decision to make 200, 500 and 1000 naira old notes illegal tender, but the CBN they disobey that order as them still stand by their earlier decision.Having said that, na over 10 states so they charge CBN and the federal government to court over the hardship wey this policy they cause, the last time them go court, them adjourn am till today, as them reconvene today, them don adjourn am again till Feb 22, but even as them they adjourn am so, Supreme court don talk say make CBN pause the matter until a verdict is reached, so tell me how country go they disobey their apex court, Naija matter tire me so. As we they talk better riot they happen for Delta state and people they die, wetin e go cost the government of Nigeria to do the right thing for once.

comments.author: Merit.s
comments.body: Due to so many destructions of properties and some death caused the CBN end of Naira note swap,Buhari came on air yesterday money to tell the public that only the 200 naira note is still a legal tender. The date to end the swap of old 200 naira to new redesigned one is in 90 days time counting from yesterday. The country has being facing so much difficulties since this swap thing. Businesses are not moving fine and this is adding more problem to our economy. The old 500 and 1000 naria note is no longer a legal tender and I know that so many Nigerians are now unhappy or frustrated because of the huge sum of old naira notes in their custody that is a waste.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: After the suspension of the Judiciary Court ruling, which led to the Mr. President announcing the old 200 note to be legal and generally accepted for the next 60 days, most banks have stopped accepting the old notes for deposit, which has caused major scarcity more than what we were facing before. Yesterday, the CBN governor announced that banks should accept the old notes for deposit only and make the new and old 200 notes available for withdrawal, which was effective immediately. I withdrew 200 from Zenith Bank yesterday, although I was only allowed to withdraw 1,000, which is 5 pieces of it. Today I saw online that any deposit above 500,000 Naira won't be accepted by any bank unless the individual sends the money directly to any CBN branch near them. What do you guys think is the fault or cause of this?
